parsed.internal_thinking: Alice has secured a strong opening with Node 20, gaining high-probability Brick (6) and Sheep (8). As Bob, my priority is to establish a high-yield foundation that complements or competes effectively. Node 42 is an exceptional choice, offering a total of 12 pips from Wheat 9 (two hexes) and Ore 5. This provides a strong start for a City and Development Card strategy, especially since Ore is relatively scarce on this board—the only other Ore hexes have numbers 3 and 2. While Node 43 offers a slightly higher yield (13 pips), it is entirely concentrated in Wheat, making it less versatile than the Wheat/Ore mix at Node 42. By taking Node 42 now, I secure the most productive Ore spot before Charlie's double turn. I plan to point my road toward Node 41 or Node 50 to eventually access the 3:1 port or additional Brick production. My second settlement will then focus on securing Wood and Sheep to balance my economy. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Secured Node 42 (O5, Wh9, Wh9) for a strong City/Dev Card foundation. Need to target Wood and Brick with the second settlement—ideally Node 11 or 12 if they remain open after Charlie's turn. Alice is currently building toward the 3:1 port at Node 9.
parsed.say_outloud: Nice choice, Alice! That Brick and Sheep combo is definitely a solid foundation. I'm going to set up on this Ore and Wheat cluster—hopefully, it'll help me keep pace with your expansion!
